title: Corporate America’s Newest Activist Investor: Donald Trump
summary: The president is demanding government stakes in U.S. companies and cuts of their revenue. Experts see some similarities to state-managed capitalism in other parts of the world.

title: Intel Agrees to Sell U.S. a 10% Stake in Its Business
summary: The deal is among the largest government interventions in a U.S. company since the rescue of the auto industry after the 2008 financial crisis.

title: Lisa Cook, Who Broke Ground at the Fed, Faces Attack by Trump
summary: The first Black woman to serve on the Federal Reserve board, Ms. Cook has long been a pathbreaker in a field dominated by white men.

title: In Trump’s Second Term, Far-Right Agenda Enters the Mainstream
summary: President Trump has embraced an array of far-right views and talking points in ways that have delighted many right-wing activists who have long supported those ideas.

title: As Trump Targets the Smithsonian, Museums Across the U.S. Feel a Chill
summary: Some museums are changing or canceling exhibits, especially those that involve artworks that engage with gender, sexuality and race.

title: Texas Legislature Gives Final Approval to Redistricting Map Favoring Republicans
summary: The map’s passage was a major victory in President Trump’s push to get Republican state leaders to help his party keep control of the U.S. House.

title: Pentagon Fires the Defense Intelligence Agency Chief
summary: The move comes weeks after the agency drafted a preliminary report contradicting President Trump’s contention that U.S. strikes had “obliterated” nuclear sites in Iran.

title: After Gaza Famine Report, U.S. Is Mostly Silent and Israel Defiant
summary: Despite outrage from its allies, the White House has not commented on a report that found famine in Gaza. Analysts say that without U.S. pressure, Israel’s war will not likely change course.

title: 5 Takeaways From Ghislaine Maxwell’s Interview About Jeffrey Epstein
summary: In a courthouse interview with the deputy attorney general, Ms. Maxwell, who has been convicted of sex trafficking, maintained that President Trump and other famous figures were not involved.

title: Can Redesigns of Wagner Park and East River Park Save Lower Manhattan?
summary: Two new parks fortifying the city’s coastline survived a bureaucratic gantlet that reveals why progress so often feels stuck.

title: Where U.S. Medicines Are Made and How Trump’s Tariffs Could Affect Them
summary: President Trump’s planned pharmaceutical tariffs threaten to hit many of the most common and well-known drugs that Americans take.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Become a Wild Card for Board Game Makers
summary: Trade war uncertainty is forcing board and card game publishers in the United States to make tough decisions, putting the future of the industry in jeopardy.

title: Iran’s Evin Prison Is Holding Dissidents Again
summary: Israel largely destroyed Evin prison, one of Iran’s most infamous symbols of oppression, in June. Less than two months later, Iran began returning male prisoners.

title: Harvard Is Making Changes Trump Officials Want, Even Without a Deal
summary: Harvard has sued, fighting the Trump administration’s demands. But the university has also enacted a host of items on the White House wish list.

title: New York Is a Big City. Its Graft Has Become Small-Town Stuff.
summary: The city’s corruption once had ambition to match its soaring skyscrapers. Indictments this week described cut-rate schemes with far lower returns — and there was that cash in a potato-chip bag.

title: With Close Associates Under Fire, Mayor Adams Remains Defiant
summary: Mayor Eric Adams defended his administration and his re-election bid on Friday amid corruption charges against some of his closest allies.

title: What to Know About Student Loan Repayment Plan Changes and Your Options
summary: Federal student loans have been upended by litigation and legislation. Here’s what you need to know to repay your loans, avoid tax bombs and more.

title: Red Lobster Is Betting on Black Diners With Its Brand Comeback
summary: Are nostalgia, a new chief executive and seafood boil bags enough to save the seafood chain after more than 60 years?

title: Trump’s Slavish Stupidity
summary: The president could learn a lesson from the sisters of Nativity.

title: What Is Trump Hiding in His Comprehensive Federal Budget Proposal?
summary: If the president plans to replace Social Security, the American people deserve to know.

title: The Water Cure
summary: Whether you swim furiously or float motionless, being in the water is a magical feeling.

title: 5 Dead After Tour Bus Crashes on Western New York Highway
summary: The bus, which was carrying 54 people to New York City from Niagara Falls, veered off the New York State Thruway near Buffalo.

title: Turning the Tables, Robert Menendez’s Wife Now Seeks to Blame Him
summary: Nadine and Robert Menendez, a former senator, were convicted of taking bribes. Seeking leniency, Ms. Menendez’s relatives and friends agree she is “not a criminal mastermind.”

title: Rising Cost of a Day at the Beach Angers Italians
summary: For Americans, the price of eggs became a rallying cry for consumers beaten down by high prices. For Italians, it’s the cost of beach umbrellas.
